author: JFK piano

text:
if random jrpgs have one thing in common, they all have at least nice tracks. Like this one, never heard of this game though and perhaps I won't hear from it anymore. Still, this music is calming and also cheering. As I said, I don't think it is that hard to find such nice songs in jrpgs but many of them are even then special.
And this one is nice and special. Thumbs up from me.
In the end, I at least think this one's an JRPG I must admit, because then again the music sounds like an JRPG >.<

author: xSayPleasex

text: A Japan exclusive RPG for the DS that came out a couple months ago. This is Michiko Naruke's first fully composed soundtrack since Wild Arms 3... That's about 10 years ago. It's great to see her back in such great form since this game has a great soundtrack with a big Naruke feel to it. This track actually reminds me of the similarly named Scenery Called Everyday from Wild Arms 3 (Best VGM 133).
